alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:16AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MANY LOCATIONS ACROSS LANCASTER COUNTY THROUGH 600 AM EDT... At 514 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking numerous strong thunderstorms along and to the east of a line extending from Lititz to Willow Street to 13 miles southeast of Millersville to 12 miles north of Havre De Grace. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Localized wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Ephrata, Lititz, Millersville, Willow Street, New Holland, Manheim, East Petersburg, Akron, Leola, Paradise, Salunga-Landisville, Denver, Reamstown, Rothsville, Strasburg, Quarryville, Gap, Adamstown and Brickerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding where 2 or more storms track across the same area. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
